meanings.definition: To carry out or perpetrate (an illegal or harmful action)
meanings.sent1: He was caught committing a crime.
meanings.sent2: She admitted to committing a mistake.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked guilty after committing the mess.
meanings.sent4: His actions were like committing a betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The image of him committing the act was disturbing.

meanings.definition: To pledge or bind oneself to a certain course of action
meanings.sent1: By signing the contract, he was committing to the project.
meanings.sent2: She was committing to a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: He felt proud after committing to his goal.
meanings.sent4: Committing to the decision felt like a weight lifted off his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The act of committing to the challenge motivated her.

meanings.definition: To entrust or consign something to someone else's care
meanings.sent1: She was committing her pet to the care of the vet.
meanings.sent2: He was committing the task to his assistant.
meanings.sent3: The child was committing his favorite toy to his friend.
meanings.sent4: Committing the responsibility to her colleague eased her mind.
meanings.sent5: The act of committing the secret to her best friend felt relieving.
